topic.title: SetupList - Share software/hardware you are using.
0web - a consice list of ZeroNet powered web services
topic.body:
It also offers .bit domain for your zeronet site (charge 0.001BTC or 0.1XMR to cover operation fee)

http://127.0.0.1:43110/0web.bit/

topic.title: 0git - a list of git repositories on ZeroNet
topic.body:
Also supports Kaffie ID. Minimal responsive card based layout.

http://127.0.0.1:43110/0git.bit

1_1GnJD7CXskmG8GywMbTvbP12wneCFW9XzR.body: Update: now SetupList has a .bit domian: [setuplist.0web.bit](/setuplist.0web.bit/)

Hello, world!

1_18R1f7hH5E71qEPtZN4CzkyguX6pu1x3ci.body:
> [cuntwagon](#comment_20_17AcmbLffN1gjfsTf6Jy8K2aBPdMaSBrrf): Hey what are you doing here?  You think you can just publicly post software keys on zeronet like that?

1. There are plenty of software keys on clearnet already.
2. How do you know @graceman live in a jurisdiction respecting those software producers' intellectual property?

If you think it is not right to use those keys, or if your jurisdiction forces you to not use those keys, then just do not use them.
